ul.li:
Plain key objects (that is, secure key objects generated by the library libcsulcca.so) can be extracted from sensitive key objects for the token by accessing the value of the CKA_IBM_OPAQUE attribute.
Plain key objects can be imported into sensitive key objects for the by assigning the plain key objects to the CKA_IBM_OPAQUE attribute value. This import is supported for key types:
DES key token
DES3 key token
AES data key token
internal RSA private key token
RSA public key token
HMAC key token
internal EC private key token
EC public key token
AES cipher key token import is not supported and C_CreateObject() returns with CKR_TEMPLATE_INCONSISTENT.
Plain key objects can also be imported into sensitive key objects for the by assigning the value to the CKA_VALUE attribute or other key-type specific attributes using the C_CreateObject() function. This is supported for RSA private keys and for RSA public keys. Starting with version 3.14, the supports the C_CreateObject() function for AES DATA, DES, DES3, and generic secret keys in addition to RSA keys. Starting with 3.14, the also supports plain HMAC and EC keys with different curves.

The default CKA_SENSITIVE setting for generating a key is CK_FALSE although the
handles only secure keys, which correspond to sensitive keys in .
Setting the value of CKA_SENSITIVE to CK_FALSE does not inhibit inspecting the value of CKA_VALUE. This setting does not compromise security because inspecting the value of CKA_VALUE does not reveal any sensitive information. The secure key token (token as used in the context) is stored in the CKA_IBM_OPAQUE attribute rather than in the CKA_VALUE attribute. Moreover, the key value is never stored in cleartext.
The function C_DigestKey is not supported by the .
